alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:40AM PST until January 15 at 10:43AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .Heavy rain along the south slopes of the Olympics and the Chehalis Valley will come to an end this afternoon. With the ground already saturated the Chehalis River at Porter will rise today reaching flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 47.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 48.6 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 345 PM PST.
